intro: Nonea anomala, commonly known as the slender sandmat, is a low-growing perennial plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its stems are often prostrate or ascending, and it produces small, dry fruits that contain seeds. Nonea anomala plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat and is of interest in ecological and botanical studies.
